interfaceFramework

Class Pacman

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaceFramework.Pacman

  • public class Pacman
extends java.lang.Object
    The class deals with the movement characteristics of Pac-Man

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pacman()
      This constructor defines the starting position of PacMan and the image paths which show the four direction-based images of Pac-Man

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getX()
      This method gets x coordinates Pac-Man

      This method gets y coordinates Pac-Man

      Moves pacman one step in a direction that has been specified by the player.
      void move(int dx, int dy)
      This method deals with the change x and y coordinates corresponding to a movement by Pac-Man
      void moveTo(int x, int y)
      This method deals with the x and y coordinates of the destination of Pac-Man
      void setX(double x)
      This method sets x coordinates Pac-Man
      void setY(double y)
      This method sets y coordinates Pac-Man

      • move

        public void move(boolean tunnel,
        double speed)
        Moves pacman one step in a direction that has been specified by the player. The specified coordinates are checked to ensure that it is not occupied by a wall using go**** methods. If no direction has been inputed by the player, pacman will continue to move in the previously inputed direction.
        Parameters:
        tunnel - boolean that indicates if the specified coordinate is a tunnel
        speed - double that displays the speed of the character

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        This method sets x coordinates Pac-Man
